prompt:
Perform hypothesis test following this example format. Be brief and direct.

Example:
Data:
Sample 1: [12.3, 14.1, 13.5, 15.2, 14.8]
Sample 2: [10.1, 11.3, 10.8, 11.9, 10.5]

Analysis:
H0: mu1 = mu2
H1: mu1 != mu2
Test: Two-sample t-test
t-statistic: 5.14
p-value: 0.0008
Decision: Reject H0 (alp = 0.05)
Conclusion: The two population means are significantly different.


---

A researcher wants to compare the means of two independent groups.

Data:
Sample 1: [np.float64(9.73772493959331), np.float64(10.697551788092591), np.float64(13.902025120252599), np.float64(14.153961058107505), np.float64(10.138762270265557), np.float64(10.320381186634151), np.float64(12.15248031493277), np.float64(8.308677934465306), np.float64(10.666140745236511), np.float64(9.948274304092287)]...
Sample 1 size: 50
Sample 1 mean: 10.0740
Sample 1 std: 2.0610

Sample 2: [np.float64(14.727724459627819), np.float64(13.790369963943371), np.float64(10.561039533430419), np.float64(8.994993087918207), np.float64(6.070942324316698), np.float64(10.91300898413473), np.float64(16.840830024494807), np.float64(12.869768542927295), np.float64(10.880855427901022), np.float64(12.930160419000613)]...
Sample 2 size: 50
Sample 2 mean: 11.9061
Sample 2 std: 2.1565

Provide analysis in the same concise format. Use only plain ASCII text. No markdown formatting.

Notation: mu=population mean, xb=sample mean, sig=population std dev, s=sample std dev, alp=significance level.
raw_response:
Analysis:
H0: mu1 = mu2
H1: mu1 != mu2
Test: Two-sample t-test
t-statistic: -4.34
p-value: 0.0000
Decision: Reject H0 (alp = 0.05)
Conclusion: The two population means are significantly different.

parsed_results.conclusion: The two population means are significantly different.

---

A researcher wants to test if a sample mean differs from a known population value.

Data:
Sample 1: [np.float64(10.609434159508863), np.float64(7.920031787519009), np.float64(11.500902391612914), np.float64(11.881129432782428), np.float64(6.097929622692327), np.float64(7.395640986275364), np.float64(10.25568080633457), np.float64(9.367514815312836), np.float64(9.966397684991422), np.float64(8.29391214485284)]...
Sample 1 size: 50
Sample 1 mean: 10.1824
Sample 1 std: 1.5366

Hypothesized population mean: 10

Provide analysis in the same concise format. Use only plain ASCII text. No markdown formatting.

Notation: mu=population mean, xb=sample mean, sig=population std dev, s=sample std dev, alp=significance level.
raw_response:
Analysis:
H0: mu = 10
H1: mu != 10
Test: One-sample t-test
t-statistic: (10.1824 - 10) / (1.5366 / sqrt(50)) = 0.84
p-value: 0.4052
Decision: Fail to reject H0 (alp = 0.05)
Conclusion: The sample mean does not significantly differ from the population mean of 10.

parsed_results.conclusion: The sample mean does not significantly differ from the population mean of 10.
